title.rendered: Anystream and Audible Magic Partner to Simplify Digital Media Commerce with Automated Content Identification Solution

content.rendered:
Solution Aimed at Dissolving UGV Business-Model Challenges to Preview at IBC 2007

(Sterling, VA & Los Gatos, CA – September 4, 2007) Today Anystream, the media automation platform used by more than 700 media organizations worldwide and Audible Magic, the industry’s top provider of content recognition technology announced an exclusive partnership to enable content identification processes to be seamlessly incorporated in UGV production workflows. The partnership will offer the digital media space a unique solution aimed at eliminating the UGV business model challenges that have popular Internet video-sharing sites struggling to avoid unintentional copyright infringement.

“The solution we developed with Audible Magic will enable content and service providers to further automate the management, manufacturing and control of media as a part of their everyday production and business processes,” said Anystream Media VP of Products Russell Zack. “We believe that it is imperative for this process to be embedded in content creation and distribution workflows.”

The new solution will combine the industry’s leading content registration and identification service with the production component of the Anystream platform to automate the registration, ingest and verification of UGV content before publishing it to the Web. By automatically fingerprinting content with associated metadata and publishing it to the Audible Magic content database for registration, the new UGV solution will enable content owners to easily identify their content in the wild. When used by aggregators, automatic ingest and format conversions will run simultaneously to the registered fingerprint checks, enabling video to be flagged for review or removal prior to publishing.

“The ability to process and manage massive amounts of media files is essential to breaking down barriers for new digital business models,” said Vance Ikezoye, Audible Magic’s CEO. “This new partnership with Anystream will make it efficient and easy for our content aggregator customers and content partners to integrate Audible Magic’s content identification platform into their digital media management ecosystems.”

For more information or a sneak preview of the new automated content ID & registration platform, visit Anystream Stand 8.295 at IBC in Amsterdam September 7-11, 2007.

Audible Magic Corporation provides content management and anti-piracy services to the media and entertainment industries as well as business, governmental, and educational institutions. The company’s offerings utilize patented content identification technologies and an extensive reference database of audio and video content that includes one of the largest collections of copyrighted digital song recording fingerprints in the world. Its digital technology and services were designed to monitor, track, manage, filter and monetize digital content in all its forms. The company has been actively providing services for the Web 2.0 user-generated content video sharing sites including MySpace, Microsoft (Soapbox), and YouTube as well as Bebo, Break.com, Dada, Dailymotion, Eyespot, GoFish, and Sony Pictures’ Crackle. The company also has an agreement with Viacom’s MTV Networks (MTVN) and the Harry Fox Agency, a leading U.S. music rights organization. Corporate partners include EMI Recorded Music, Palisade Systems, Sony/BMG Music, Universal Music Group, V2 Music, Warner Music Group, and EMI Recorded Music. Audible Magic is also employed by iMesh and PlayLouder MSP music service. Audible Magic products include the CopySense P2P Plug-In, CopySense Network Appliance, and RepliCheck. For more information please visit: http://vps15579.inmotionhosting.com/~audibl8

As the number of outlets and devices to consume video content grows, Anystream enables media companies and educators to innovate and experiment with new media to reach their consumers and students where, when, and how it’s convenient for them. With the bragging rights to over 600 media customers and more than 150 higher education institutions, Anystream is the known leader for on demand video solutions. The company’s scalable, enterprise rich media solutions can be found from MIT to MTV and beyond. Anystream’s honors include the Frost & Sullivan Market Leadership Award, Presentations Magazine’s Standing Ovation Award, PC Magazine’s Technical Excellence Awards finalist, COMDEX Best of Show awards finalist, Entrepreneur Magazine’s “Hot 100” list and Deloitte & Touche’s “Fast 50.” For more information please visit:http://www.anystream.com

Anystream Contact

Matt Dornic
Anystream
703.948.3076 or 443.414.1393
mdornic@anystream.com

For more information, visit Audible Magic’s website at www.audiblemagic.com or contact:

Audible Magic Media & Analyst Inquiries

Jay Friedman
Vice President of Marketing and Product Management
408-399-6405 x238
j_friedman@audiblemagic.com
